summary: An email exchange between an FBI Special Agent and a conference director regarding an investigation into whether Jeffrey Epstein attended a financial conference in New Orleans between 1998-2000. The FBI agent is seeking information about Epstein's potential attendance at the New Orleans Investment Conference during that period.

persons.name: Adele Thonn
persons.context: Conference Director for Jefferson Financial, Inc. who responds to the FBI's inquiry about Epstein's potential attendance at the New Orleans Investment Conference, indicating her organization found no information.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Individual whom the FBI is investigating to determine if he attended the New Orleans Investment Conference between 1998-2000.

connections.description: FBI Special Agent Jo is investigating Jeffrey Epstein's potential attendance at a financial conference in New Orleans.
FBI agent contacts conference director seeking information about Epstein's potential conference attendance.

events.title: Potential Epstein Conference Attendance
events.description: FBI investigation into whether Jeffrey Epstein attended the New Orleans Investment Conference during this timeframe.

events.title: FBI Inquiry Initiated
events.description: FBI Special Agent Jo sends initial email to Adele Thonn inquiring about Epstein's potential conference attendance.

events.title: Conference Director Response
events.description: Adele Thonn responds to FBI inquiry, indicating no information found about Epstein attending their conference.

locations: West Palm Beach, FL (505 Flagler Dr. Ste. 500)
keyFacts: The FBI was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's activities in 2011, specifically his potential attendance at financial conferences in New Orleans between 1998-2000.
The FBI agent contacted the New Orleans Investment Conference director to determine if Epstein attended their event during the specified timeframe.
The conference director reported finding no information about Epstein attending their conference and suggested contacting the New Orleans Convention & Visitors Bureau for broader records.
This document shows law enforcement was investigating Epstein's travel and professional activities years before his 2019 arrest.
The investigation appears focused on establishing Epstein's movements and professional connections during the late 1990s.
